body:
It is because your 8088 port is already in use. 
Try the following command : lsof -i :8088 
You will get the pid (2d column) of the process running on port 8088 , you can kill them

Thanks lilia! (happy International Women's Day! and hurray for women coders! :)

I found and killed those processes dn run $ superset runserver -p 8088 and have to kill the process because it hangs. I check the process again and see: 

[ec2-user@ip-10-0-2-39 ~]$ lsof -i :8088
COMMAND   PID     USER   FD   TYPE  DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
gunicorn 3102 ec2-user    5u  IPv4 6339978      0t0  TCP *:radan-http (LISTEN)
gunicorn 3107 ec2-user    5u  IPv4 6339978      0t0  TCP *:radan-http (LISTEN)
gunicorn 3110 ec2-user    5u  IPv4 6339978      0t0  TCP *:radan-http (LISTEN)

I tried in venv as well with the same results.

Thanks!
The bug still exists in superset 0.17.0; adding this information to the initial report.
the folder `translations` is not within `python/dist-packages/superset/`, because `setup.py` do not packed it, and thus the translation don't work.
Once you restarted superset server is it working?

you tried this url :  http://0.0.0.0:8088 ?

Ok , and is the port 8088 open? 
I am not a EC2 user but I guess it is not open by default. May be have a look at this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9209049/open-a-http-port-on-amazon-ec2

I did add 8088 to iptables and restarted but, exact same result. 
I updated my aws security groups specifically for this port as well.

Scratch that. I went back to my browser and it's accessing now. So, my not adding 8088 to the iptables was the source of the problem. Thank you very much. I have a big presentation in about six days and this is going to help immensely.

If not, someone would have to create a new connector for it. Luckily I recently refactored and formalized the connector abstraction.

Hi,I,m meet the same problem,when I run the superset db upgrade,it said it is not internal command，how do you solve it ?

after 15.4.0 React DOM implementation has been moved completely to the React DOM package. in the earlier versions react-dom package import the module from react/lib/ReactDOM. but now the module is itself inside the react-dom package ./lib/ReactDOM.

Had one more comment on Bubble Viz Type, but maybe applicable to other viz types:
1. You need to run "pd.to_datetime()" to convert datetime to SQL recognized datetime format.
2. In pd.to_sql(), dtype parameter is necessary for at least 3 parameter:
  a. DateTime() for your datetime parameter.
  b. Series parameter for bubble chart must be String() type
  c. Entity parameter for bubble chart must be String() type
  Otherwise, none of above could recognize correctly in sqlab somehow. Maybe it's common sense but just record here in case it's not.

I don't know anything about pydruid, but actually I don't see any "*avg" aggregations in latest Druid at all, so it's strange that you use such aggregation in you code. Could you explain please?
Can you please name minimal requirements for my pull request to be accepted?

Found the issue.

Migrations hadn't run properly. You can tell from the fact that the params field for the slice before and after migrations hadn't changed. As part of the migrations all of the JSON blobs are upgraded rather than it being performed on read.

Running migrations manually worked a charm - the reason they didn't run is related to our own deployment methods and not related to superset. Good work on this update guys - I love it.
Would it be possible to know the list of NoSql databases currently supported by Superset? Is there a list or additional information somewhere. By the way, also in favour of an Elasticsearch support.

@mistercrunch @xrmx

You're not providing enough information on what your expected results are. 

If I understand correctly, you ran the superset server and now you want to proceed? if so, go ahead and setup your admin login using "superset superset-init" command. Please follow the instructions on the README file if this doesn't resolve.

We also need this feature. It would allow to create a pure *visualization consumer role*. This role would have less permission than the gamma role : with the permission to see dashboards, to download the aggregated data, but not to explore freely the raw data on the slice view.

We did not dive in superset source code yet. Do you have an estimation of the complexity to implement it ?
Hopefully superset behaves like every other application that uses flask-migrate, you may want to check its documentation.
Yes, it is running very slow, will take more 20s when refresh data. Did you fix that?
Closing as ~2 months without user activity.
LGTM
Missed updating this thread but this closing note might help. In my case the problem was with the AWS load balancer. Switching to Route53 worked fine.
closing this in favor of two smaller PRs. one for the quick formatting win, and another next week for the refactored table component.
so psyched for this feature!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
looks like y'all patched this up, so i'm a-closing this
@data-strategy that is a different issue.
Build problem was coveralls hick up, mergin'

Additional note: the broken state is dependent on the screen resolution - e.g. on my laptop, they are broken as in OP, but if I connect a larger screen, they work fine - without needing refresh. In general screen resolution should not affect correct rendering, as I could build a dashboard that looks great to me, and then send it someone else who will be unable to view it.

tl;dr - if rendering is going to fail, it should do so reliably.
ping
